intro: Chamaenerion bondarenkoi, commonly known as the Crimean fireweed, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as riverbanks and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Chamaenerion bondarenkoi is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants known for their showy blooms.
